txt.en: 'None can stop us, my people!'
'[placeholder], my friend.'
Follow Durin to the dwarves labouring at the ice
'I will need your help, and that of every Longbeard, to reclaim what is ours.'
Talk to Durin outside the gates of Gundabad
Durin wishes to observe the progress made by the dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ outside the gates of Gundabad.
DNT - Blah!
'This way, my friend. See how my dwarves labour at the ice? Nothing stands long before my people when they set their minds and muscles to overcoming it!'
Durin, Prince of the Longbeards, and Ingór, Prince of the Zhélruka, have commanded their forces to break through the ice that blocks passage into Gundabad.
'Put your back into it, fellows! This unnatural ice cannot keep us from our goal, and it will not!\n\n'Already I hear the ice cracking, [placeholder]! It will not be long before we are through!'

'I ordered some of my own fellows to bring up torches, and with their help we will weaken this ice. Have I not personally seen strong metal bend and twist in the forges of the Heart of Fire? I have, [placeholder]. So too will it be here.\n\n'This may be a dragon's ice, but it is ice all the same.'
Prince Ingór desires to wield a sword, not a pick-axe, in service of the effort to gain entrance to Gundabad.

'Prince Ingór ordered that I help break through the ice alongside these Longbeards, but even without that command I would do it. Let them see the Zhélruka hold true to their word.\n\n'Even now cracks begin to form deep in the ice! We will soon be through!'
'I toiled long in Mordor, [placeholder], but this is not the same.\n\n'It is much colder up here.'

'My folk toil no less than Durin's Longbeards, and I beam with pride to hear no complaint! But my skill is with the sword and not with the pick-axe. There must be another way I can aid this effort.'

The Zhélruka prince falls silent, listening closely.

'Do you hear that, [placeholder]? Our foes deliver just such a use for my talents!'
Rúvaran's forces have been routed, and now Durin is eager to return to the work of breaking through the ice before Gundabad.
'I daresay we won't see him again, but if we do he will regret it. Let Ingór keep watch for him. You and I will return to the ice and help as we may.'
Durin is eager to pass beyond the ice and into Gundabad.
Fight alongside Prince Ingór in defence of the labouring dwarves
Durin stands on the landing before the gates of Gundabad, eager to pass into the Mountain-home.
Durin has fallen!
'This is it, [placeholder]. Nothing stands in our way.\n\n'Let us climb the rest of the way and pass into Gundabad, the Mountain-home of my people!'
DNT - Blah!
'Who thinks to command me?'
Talk to Durin
At long last, Durin has entered the Mountain-home.
'Your warriors are led by a pair of princes?'
Follow Durin
'I can hardly believe it, [placeholder], and yet here we stand.\n\n'Gundabad at last!'
'A crown ill fits two heads.'
Talk to Durin on the landing outside Gundabad
'I am Rúvaran, and I say to you this:'
'You command nothing.'
'The masters of Gundabad are generous to those who serve them.'
Climb the stairs and pass through the gates into Gundabad
'Gorgar made me a gift of his warriors.'
Talk to Durin inside Gundabad
'Orcs! Slay them, and you will be rewarded!'
'I have loyal servants enough to deal with the like of you!'
'There is much to be done.'
Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ work to break through the ice that blocks passage into Gundabad.
'Look there! All of Gundabad lies before us, my friends.'
'Enough!'
'My kill-beasts will take care of you!'
'Attack!'
'This is it, [placeholder]. Nothing stands in our way.\n\n'Let us climb the rest of the way and pass into Gundabad, the Mountain-home of our people!'
The gates of Gundabad lie before you, atop the stairs.
'Let us see the progress of the Gabil'akkâ!'
Talk to Bósi, former leader of the Iron Garrison
'Swing those picks, my fellows!'
Talk to Stóthkell, forge-master of the Iron Garrison
'We will be through this ice in no time!'
Talk to Venko of the Zhélruka
'The Red Axe will provide a suitable welcome, I think!'
Talk to Imák the Stout-axe
'And I am Durin, son of Thorin Stonehelm and prince of the Longbeards.'
Talk to Prince Ingór at the ice outside Gundabad
'I command the Gabil'akkâ, and we will have Gundabad once more!'
'It seems Gorgar did not gift you his best Orcs, Rúvaran.'
<rgb=#FF0000>Durin and Ingór must not be defeated!</rgb>
'Let us see how the work progresses!'
'Look there, [placeholder]!'
'Gundabad!'
'For Durin!'
'The Longbeards!'
'Gundabad belongs to us!'
'Aye, they will soon be upon us. Let us greet them first.'
Walk with Durin
'For Prince Durin and King Thorin!'
'Follow me, [placeholder]!'
'That's far enough, villain. One more step and you will be slain.'
'For Ingór and the Zhélruka!'
Instance: Breaking Through
'I am Ingór, son of Vékun and prince of the Zhélruka.'
'Gundabad! Gundabad!'
'I command anyone I choose to command: Man, dwarf, or Elf!'
'Gundabad for the Zhélruka!'
'I will watch for Rúvaran. He will find no mercy if he returns!'
'They have broken through the ice!'
